entry.title: Combined summary - Security implications of using pseudorandom JSON-RPC IDs
entry.summary: The core of the inquiry revolves around the operational mechanism of the Bitcoin Core RPC server, specifically regarding its handling of UniValue JSON-RPC requests. The person expressing concern, Ali, is developing an application that employs pseudorandom IDs for these JSON-RPC calls. The crux of Ali's apprehension lies in ensuring that the Bitcoin Core system is designed in a manner that prevents the potential security risk of mistakenly sending back another user's JSON-RPC response when identical pseudorandom IDs are generated and used simultaneously by different users. Despite diligent efforts, Ali has yet to uncover relevant insights within the GitHub codebase concerning this matter. The request made by Ali is essentially a plea for clarification or additional information from anyone knowledgeable on the subject, aiming to mitigate any security vulnerabilities that could arise from the aforementioned scenario.
